#summary In Mesquite use HQL to select all matrices in the pPOD database which contain both 'Equus' and 'Sus'

=Use HQL to select all matrices in the pPOD database which contain both 'Equus' and 'Sus'=

===In Mesquite, get started by choosing _HQL Query against pPOD database..._:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/1-mesqSelectHQL.png]

===Enter in our HQL query:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/2-mesqHQLQueryWindow.png]

===The results:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/3-mesqQueryResults.png]

===Have a look at the first matrix:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/4-mesqMatrix1Detail.png]

===Highlight all non-Equus and non-Sus taxa:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/5-mesqEqSusDehighlighted.png]

===Get rid of all non-Equus and non-Sus taxa:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/6-mesqCut.png]

===Only left with Equus and Sus:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/7-mesqAfterCut.png]

===Rename them to Equus1 and Sus1 in anticipation of combining with other matrices:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/7.1-rename1stMatrixTaxaToX1.png]

===Using a similiar technique as the one we used for cutting out taxa, whittle down to the characters we want: ===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/7.2-cutUnwantedCharsFrom1stMatrix.png]

===View the second matrix returned:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/8-mesqChoose2ndTaxa.png]

===Get rid of taxa we don't want and rename to Equus2 and Sus2:===
[http://penn-ppod.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Pictures/SelectEquusAndSusMatrices/9-rename2ndMatrixTaxaToX2.png]
